WRITING.TEXT: I saw this today - I fucking loved it. I really hope that Jordan Peele gets an Oscar nomination either for his screenplay or his direction - both were top-notch (I especially loved the opening shot that was done in a single take). Allison Williams was also creepy as hell in this - a Best Supporting Actress nomination for her would be well-deserved.

WRITING.TEXT:
I predicted $26.7 million [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/boxoffice/comments/5x6vgg/get_out_second_weekend_predictions/) - pretty damn close! :) I also think Universal is being very conservative with their estimated Sunday drop, so it likely have $27-28 million once final numbers come out tomorrow.
Also, is the first time that we've seen the top two movies at the box office be R-rated in a while? I feel like we don't see that very often.

Fantastic opening for Logan - I think it's going to have a better-than-expected drop on Sunday, as evidenced by the sold out showings I'm seeing (including at my local theater today).
Amazing drop for Get Out - word-of-mouth is really out of this world. This baby could do $150 million+ now, especially if its terrific legs continue.

What are your predictions for Get Out's second weekend? After the terrific week days it's been having (clearly benefiting from incredible word-of-mouth), I'm going to predict it'll have a second weekend of $26.7 million (a 20% drop from last weekend).
Even with Logan probably getting a huge opening weekend, I think that Get Out will still perform extremely well even in the face of huge competition.
